text: The 12819 / 12820 Odisha Sampark Kranti Express is a bi-weekly train which runs between Bhubaneswar, Capital of Odisha and Anand Vihar Terminal. This train was introduced as part of the Sampark Kranti trains that were announced by the then railway minister Nitish Kumar in 2005. It was and still is a bi- weekly train. Now there is a requirement of attaching AC First class berths to this train. Earlier the train used to terminate at New Delhi railway station (NDLS) but now terminates at Anand Vihar Terminus (ANVT) of New Delhi. Its rakes are maintained by East Coast Railway (ECoR). 371x371px == Rake Composition == This train consists of 1 AC 2-tier coach, 4 AC 3-tier coaches, 11 sleeper coaches, 3 general coaches,1 pantry car and 2 EOG coaches and hence making it a 22 coach train. ==Stoppage== It runs, from via , , , , , , , , to . == Loco Link == As the route is fully electrified. this train gets a WAP 7 locomotive of Ghaziabad shed end to end. ==Time - Table== From to Anand Vihar Terminal- 12819.
